summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from July 7-8, 2020, discussing updates and coordination regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case following her arrest. The emails focus on requests for Significant Case Notifications (SCNs) related to her bail hearing, proffer sessions, and whether any new victims have come forward.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Addressed in the initial email forwarding a request for updates on Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; the FBI is coordinating to receive updates on her bail hearing, proffer sessions, and potential new victims following her arrest.

events.title: Maxwell transferred to FDC Brooklyn
events.description: An email references an article stating Ghislaine Maxwell was transferred to a Federal Detention Center (FDC) in Brooklyn.

events.title: Request for updates on Maxwell's legal proceedings
events.description: FBI personnel request Significant Case Notifications (SCNs) for Maxwell's bail hearing, arraignment hearings, proffer sessions, and any new victims coming forward.

keyFacts: The FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit (CACHTU) was actively coordinating updates on Ghislaine Maxwell's case in July 2020.
A key request was for Significant Case Notifications (SCNs) regarding Maxwell's bail hearing outcome and any scheduled proffer sessions.
An email explicitly states 'No new victims' had come forward as of July 7, 2020, regarding Maxwell's arrest.
The email chain indicates Maxwell had been transferred to a Federal Detention Center in Brooklyn, as reported in an article.
